title: (x) "The Bollocks" from Sex Pistols album cover - (similar to) Century Cd {Tiff}
content:
What is this classic typeface used on the cover of the Sex Pistols album? I thought this was going to be an easy identification, but it has proved a bit harder than I expected. Some close matches have been Concorde and Century.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [the\_bollocks.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140121011953/http:/typophile.com/files/the_bollocks.jpg) | 64.69 KB |
author: b_keith

comments.content: Elsner+Flake's [Century Bold Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20140121011953/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/itc-century/century-ef-bold-condensed/) feels close. But, I don't know that this would've been type so much as some sort of rub-down lettering.

Miss Tiffany, I don't think that E&F CBC is really too close, but Keith, Jamie Reid designed all the Pistols stuff and he did a lot of it with Letterpress work too. I think more than font matching in this instance, what you need is the ability to transform the idea to your situation and that is why it worked for Mr. Reid. Jamie Reid allegedly wrote most of the Lyrics for them too!  
My goodness 30 years and I am no longer who I was then, thank God(:!  
The best song they ever did was "Satalite", which did not make it on that album, but I had the bootleg for years!

The Truth shall set you free
